Class ConcurrencyControlProtocol

java.lang.Object
concurrencyControlProtocol.ConcurrencyControlProtocol
Direct Known Subclasses:
G_FMLP, MrsP, None, NPCS, PIP
public abstract class ConcurrencyControlProtocol extends Object
Abstract base class for concurrency control protocols.

This class defines lifecycle hooks and operations that a concurrency control protocol must provide to interact with the scheduling environment and jobs. Implementations should provide concrete behaviors for job arrival, preemption, blocking/unblocking, completion, deadline misses, and any pre-scheduling setup.

Integrated notes from existing inline comments:

  • The preAction(Processor) method is intended for pre-operations which must be done before scheduling begins (前置作業，在排程開始前就該做得事，就寫在這個function裡).
Author:
ShiuJia

  • Constructor Details

    • ConcurrencyControlProtocol

      public ConcurrencyControlProtocol()
      Default constructor.

      Initializes the protocol name and parent controller to null.

  • Method Details

    • preAction

      public abstract void preAction(Processor p)
      Perform pre-scheduling actions for the given processor.

      Use this hook to perform any initialization or setup that must occur before scheduling begins on the specified processor. (前置作業，在排程開始前就該做得事，就寫在這個function裡)

      Parameters:
      p - the Processor on which to perform pre-scheduling actions

    • jobArrivesAction

      public abstract void jobArrivesAction(Job j)
      Handle the event of a job arriving to the system.
      Parameters:
      j - the arriving Job

    • jobPreemptedAction

      public abstract void jobPreemptedAction(Job preemptedJob, Job nextJob)
      Handle the event where a job is preempted by another job.

      The inline comment clarifies roles: preemptedJob is the job that was preempted (typically the lower-priority job), and nextJob is the job that preempted it (typically the higher-priority job).

      Parameters:
      preemptedJob - the Job that was preempted (lower priority)
      nextJob - the Job that caused the preemption (higher priority)

    • checkJobFirstExecuteAction

      public abstract boolean checkJobFirstExecuteAction(Job j)
      Check whether the given job should be treated as its first execution.
      Parameters:
      j - the Job to check
      Returns:
      true if the job is considered to be executing for the first time and any first-execution protocol actions should be applied; false otherwise

    • jobFirstExecuteAction

      public abstract void jobFirstExecuteAction(Job j)
      Perform actions associated with a job's first execution.
      Parameters:
      j - the Job that is executing for the first time

    • checkJobLockAction

      public abstract SharedResource checkJobLockAction(Job j, SharedResource r)
      Check and/or attempt to lock a shared resource on behalf of a job.

      Implementations may return the resource that was actually locked, a different resource that affects locking decisions, or null to indicate no lock was obtained. The exact meaning depends on the concrete protocol implementation.

      Parameters:
      j - the Job requesting or checking the lock
      r - the SharedResource the job wants to lock
      Returns:
      the SharedResource that represents the result of the lock check (e.g., the resource granted, or a resource indicating blocking), or null if no resource is granted or applicable

    • jobBlockedAction

      public abstract void jobBlockedAction(Job blockedJob, SharedResource blockingRes)
      Handle the event of a job becoming blocked due to a shared resource.
      Parameters:
      blockedJob - the Job that is blocked
      blockingRes - the SharedResource that is causing the block

    • jobUnlockAction

      public abstract void jobUnlockAction(Job j, SharedResource r)
      Handle unlocking of a shared resource by a job.
      Parameters:
      j - the Job that is unlocking the resource
      r - the SharedResource being unlocked

    • jobCompletedAction

      public abstract void jobCompletedAction(Job j)
      Handle the completion of a job.
      Parameters:
      j - the Job that has completed

    • jobMissDeadlineAction

      public abstract void jobMissDeadlineAction(Job j)
      Handle the event that a job missed its deadline.
      Parameters:
      j - the Job that missed its deadline

    • setName

      public void setName(String n)
      Set the name of this concurrency control protocol instance.
      Parameters:
      n - the name to assign

    • setParentController

      public void setParentController(ConcurrencyController c)
      Set the parent ConcurrencyController that manages this protocol.
      Parameters:
      c - the parent ConcurrencyController

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Get the name of this protocol instance.
      Returns:
      the protocol name, or null if not set

    • getParentController

      public ConcurrencyController getParentController()
      Get the parent ConcurrencyController associated with this protocol.
      Returns:
      the parent ConcurrencyController, or null if none has been set
